intro: Siparuna griseoflavescens, commonly known as the golden-flowered siparuna, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small, globose berries that turn from green to dark purple as they mature. Siparuna griseoflavescens is valued in traditional medicine for its potential medicinal properties.
